newsitem.title: USA: Jayhawk sees Q4 earnings cut by $0.05/shr.
newsitem.headline: Jayhawk sees Q4 earnings cut by $0.05/shr.

text.p: Jayhawk Acceptance Corp on Tuesday estimated that expenses incured by its Jayhawk Medical Acceptance unit will cut the parent's earnings by about $0.05 per share for the fourth quarter of 1996.
The company attributed the losses to the inception of its medical finance program.

In a statement, Jayhawk Chairman and Chief Executive Michael Smartt said, "Although the roll-out of the Jayhawk Medical program will partially offset the anticipated results of the company's automotive finance business through at least the first quarter of 1997, we cannot ignore the opportunities exhibited by the medical finance program."
"We view the expansion of Jayhawk Medical as an investment in the company's future," he said.
